We can communicate that you will see him in a week and half as scheduled, and can celebrate then, you if did not do so already last Sunday, which
was the scheduled time.

Subject:Re: Adrian's Birthday
Message 3038 of 4024
I think you have typos. I’m not trying to be difficult. I just don’t understand what you’re saying. Also I’m pretty sure for the next visit. It’s Father’s
Day so the occasion is kind of already taken.
Sent:06/05/2024 at 10:13 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 06/06/2024 at 08:21 AM)
Subject:Re: Adrian's Birthday
Message 3039 of 4024
.. we are well past the argument, I’d like you to turn these back on for urgent and emergency situations. That was our deal. Please honor it. Thanks!
Sent:06/05/2024 at 10:19 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 06/06/2024 at 08:21 AM)
Subject:OFW Communications
Attachments:IMG_0672.PNG (227 KB)
Message 3040 of 4024
My experience has been you have used for non-urgent or emergency situations.
I will turn back on, but will also discuss with attorney how to proceed if used for non urgent calls.
Sent:06/06/2024 at 09:22 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 06/06/2024 at 09:38 AM)
Subject:Re: OFW Communications
Message 3041 of 4024
Makes sense. Thank you.
In that context, can we explore the communication protocols suggested four months ago, like allowing us to share things and have updates or decision
discussions via email?
We are just trashing our relationship by putting artificial barriers to collaboration in place. I can say the same thing here as I can there, so there really is
no reason to make things so divisive and impossible on purpose.
Sent:06/06/2024 at 10:53 AM
From:Robert Moyer

Subject:Re: OFW Communications
